title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A timeless classic about the American Dream.
description: A story of wealth, love, and disillusionment in the Roaring Twenties.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
review: A gripping story of racial injustice in the American South.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
review: A witty and romantic exploration of social class and marriage.
description: The story of Elizabeth Bennet and her relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
review: A raw portrayal of teenage angst and rebellion.
description: Holden Caulfield shares his experiences of alienation in a critical world.

title: TEST
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A charming and adventurous prelude to the epic Lord of the Rings.
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected journey to help reclaim a lost dwarven kingdom.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bront
review: A bold narrative of love, independence, and resilience.
description: Jane's journey from a troubled childhood to a passionate romance with Mr. Rochester.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
review: A chilling tale of creation and consequence.
description: Victor Frankenstein creates life and must face the horrific results.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
review: The classic vampire novel that started it all.
description: A gripping story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to Englandddd.
